--- title: "flextable" description: "This is a subtitle" date: "2024-07-04" --- ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(flextable) library(tibble) library(stringr) library(dplyr) ``` ::: Data for the table: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} sw <- starwars %>% select(name, height, mass, hair_color, eye_color, gender, starships) %>% slice_head(n = 10) sw ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 10 × 7 name height mass hair_color eye_color gender starships 1 Luke Skywalker 172 77 blond blue mascul… 2 C-3PO 167 75 yellow mascul… 3 R2-D2 96 32 red mascul… 4 Darth Vader 202 136 none yellow mascul… 5 Leia Organa 150 49 brown brown femini… 6 Owen Lars 178 120 brown, grey blue mascul… 7 Beru Whitesun Lars 165 75 brown blue femini… 8 R5-D4 97 32 red mascul… 9 Biggs Darklighter 183 84 black brown mascul… 10 Obi-Wan Kenobi 182 77 auburn, white blue-gray mascul… ``` ::: ::: Passing to `flextable()` ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} sw %>% flextable() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}

name

height

mass

hair_color

eye_color

gender

starships

blond

blue-gray

[[character]]

``` ::: ::: Using `autofit()` to produce nice column spacing: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} sw %>% flextable() %>% autofit() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}

name

height

``` ::: ::: Combine with dplyr to tidy up printed values: ::: {.cell} ```{.e .cell-code} sw %>% mutate(across(hair_color:gender, str_to_title)) %>% flextable() %>% autofit() ``` ::: Use `set_header_labels()` to format the column labels: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} sw %>% mutate(across(hair_color:gender, str_to_title)) %>% flextable() %>% autofit() %>% set_header_labels( name = "Character Name", height = "Height (cm)", mass = "Mass (kg)", hair_color = "Hair Color", eye_color = "Eye Color", sex = "Sex", gender = "Gender", starships = "Starships" ) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}

Character Name

Height (cm)

Mass (kg)

Hair Color

Eye Color

Gender

Starships

Luke Skywalker

172

77

[[character]]

[[character]]

``` ::: ::: Use `compose()` or `mk_par()` to build cell contents from constituent parts: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} sw %>% mutate(across(hair_color:gender, str_to_title)) %>% flextable() %>% autofit() %>% set_header_labels( name = "Character Name", height = "Height", mass = "Mass", hair_color = "Hair Color", eye_color = "Eye Color", sex = "Sex", gender = "Gender", starships = "Starships" ) %>% compose( j = "height", value = as_paragraph(height, "cm") ) %>% compose( j = "mass", value = as_paragraph(mass, "kg") ) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}

Character Name

Height

Mass

Hair Color

Eye Color

Gender

Starships

Luke Skywalker

77.0kg

Masculine

``` ::: ::: Fancier formatting to a specific chunk using `as_chunk()` and `fp_text_default()`: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} sw %>% mutate(across(hair_color:gender, str_to_title)) %>% flextable() %>% autofit() %>% set_header_labels( name = "Character Name", height = "Height", mass = "Mass", hair_color = "Hair Color", eye_color = "Eye Color", sex = "Sex", gender = "Gender", starships = "Starships" ) %>% compose( j = "height", value = as_paragraph( height, as_chunk("cm", props = fp_text_default(color = "grey50")) ) ) %>% compose( j = "mass", value = as_paragraph( mass, as_chunk("kg", props = fp_text_default(color = "grey50")) ) ) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}

Character Name

``` ::: ::: Using fancier row selectors to get contextual formatting: ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} sw %>% mutate(across(hair_color:gender, str_to_title)) %>% flextable() %>% autofit() %>% set_header_labels( name = "Character Name", height = "Height", mass = "Mass", hair_color = "Hair Color", eye_color = "Eye Color", sex = "Sex", gender = "Gender", starships = "Starships" ) %>% compose( j = "height", value = as_paragraph( height, as_chunk("cm", props = fp_text_default(color = "grey50")) ) ) %>% compose( j = "mass", value = as_paragraph( mass, as_chunk("kg", props = fp_text_default(color = "grey50")) ) ) %>% color( i = ~ eye_color == "Red", j = "eye_color", color = "red" ) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
